name: Testosterone Cypionate
description: A common form of testosterone used to induce masculinizing effects such as deepening of the voice, increased muscle mass, and facial hair growth.

name: Testosterone Enanthate
description: Another form of testosterone, similar to cypionate, used in testosterone replacement therapy for masculinizing changes.

name: Testosterone Gel
description: A topical gel form of testosterone applied to the skin for gradual absorption, resulting in masculinizing effects over time.

name: Estradiol Valerate
description: An injectable form of estradiol used to promote feminizing effects such as breast development, fat redistribution, and reduced muscle mass.

name: Estradiol Patch
description: A transdermal patch applied to the skin, slowly releasing estradiol to induce feminizing effects.

name: Estradiol Tablets
description: Oral form of estradiol used in feminizing hormone therapy for promoting breast growth, softer skin, and other feminizing changes.

name: Spironolactone
description: A potassium-sparing diuretic that also serves as an anti-androgen, blocking testosterone effects and aiding in the feminization process.

name: Finasteride
description: Used to block the conversion of testosterone into dihydrotestosterone (DHT), reducing hair loss in MTF individuals and sometimes prescribed for FTM to address male-pattern hair loss.

name: Progesterone
description: Used in some feminizing hormone regimens to support breast development and other secondary sexual characteristics.

name: Leuprolide Acetate
description: A GnRH agonist that suppresses the production of testosterone or estrogen, commonly used in both MTF and FTM HRT to delay puberty or suppress hormone production before starting HRT.
